intro: Diplycosia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf diplycosia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of small white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
